channel.title: NASACast Audio
channel.description: NASACast combines the content of all the NASACast subject area podcasts into a single omnibus podcast. Here you'll find the latest news and features on NASA's missions as well as the popular "This Week @NASA" newsreel.
channel.itunes:subtitle: NASACast combines the content of all the NASACast subject area podcasts into a single omnibus podcast. Here you'll find the late
channel.itunes:summary: NASACast combines the content of all the NASACast subject area podcasts into a single omnibus podcast. Here you'll find the latest news and features on NASA's missions as well as the popular "This Week @NASA" newsreel.
channel.itunes:keywords: NASA, Portal, audio, MP3s, NASATV, shuttle, Discovery, This Week at NASA, news, space, Mars, Earth, shuttle, Moon, station, nati
channel.itunes:author: National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)

item.title: This Week @NASA, June 7, 2019
item.description: NASA Opens International Space Station to Commercial Opportunities, SpaceX Dragon Cargo Spacecraft Returns from Space Station and more ...

item.title: Spaceship Crash Testing
item.description: Mark Baldwin, Orion Occupant Protection Specialist, talks about crash testing of the Orion spacecraft and why it is important to keep the crew safe during some of the most critical moments of their mission. HWHAP Episode 95.

item.title: Gravity Assist Podcast: Why So Many Craters on the Moon? With David Kring
item.description: NASA's Artemis program will send astronauts to the lunar south pole by 2024, where there is a giant impact crater. Learn how craters teach us about the history of both the Moon and Earth.

item.title: This Week @NASA, May 31, 2019
item.description: First Robotic Commercial Moon Landers Selected for Artemis Program, Bridenstine Speaks at NASA Advisory Council Meeting and more ...

item.title: Mental Health with Shinedown
item.description: In honor of Mental Health Awareness Month, NASA chats with the rock band Shinedown about the similarities and importance of mental health for orbiting astronauts, touring band members… and everyone! HWHAP Episode 94.

item.title: Gravity Assist Podcast: Where's the Water on the Moon? With Jen Heldmann
item.description: The Moon has a large supply of water that could be useful in future human exploration, says NASA scientist Jennifer Heldmann.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 11, Commercial Crew
item.description: Jon Cowart, a veteran space engineer, discusses NASA’s Commercial Crew Program and progress toward launching astronauts from American soil.

item.title: This Week @NASA, May 24, 2019
item.description: Company Named to Provide Lunar Gateway Power and Propulsion Element, Orion’s Ascent Abort-2 Flight Test Article Rolls Out to the Pad and more ...

item.title: Space Medicine at Comicpalooza
item.description: Science fiction meets science fact during a live panel discussion at Comicpalooza in Houston about current medical innovations in space with NASA medical scientists and Star Trek: The Next Generation star Gates McFadden. HWHAP Episode 93.

item.title: This Week @NASA, May 17, 2019
item.description: Budget Amendment Supporting Humans on Moon in 2024, Shrinking Moon May Be Generating Moonquakes and more ...
